1094710.1134/10947.1573-8779Journal of Structural ChemistryJ Struct Chem0022-47661573-8779Pleiades PublishingMoscowS0022476619050159119710.1134/S0022476619050159ArticleGadolinium Break in a Series of Three-Dimensional trans-1,4-Cyclohexane Dicarboxylates of Rare Earth ElementsDemakovP. A.12SapchenkoS. A.12SamsonenkoD. G.12DybtsevD. N.12FedinV. P.12e0000 0001 2192 9124grid.4886.2Nikolaev Institute of Inorganic Chemistry, Siberian BranchRussian Academy of SciencesNovosibirskRussia0000000121896553grid.4605.7Novosibirsk State UniversityNovosibirskRussiacluster@niic.nsc.ru13620195201960581582212620191611201820112018241220181362019© Pleiades Publishing, Ltd. 20192019Abstract

By a reaction of lanthanide nitrates with trans-1,4-cyclohexane dicarboxylic acid H2chdc in an aqueous medium new coordination polymers with the composition [Ln2(H2O)4(chdc)3] (Ln = Ce (1), Sm (2), Eu (3), Gd (4)) are obtained. Crystallization conditions are optimized with the use of a hexamine-based pH buffer. Compound 1 is additionally characterized by powder X-ray diffraction, elemental and thermogravimetric analyses, and IR spectroscopy. The structure of the obtained compounds is determined by single crystal X-ray diffraction. In a series of isostructural three-dimensional frameworks [Ln2(H2O)4(chdc)3] (Ln = La—Eu, except Pm) a regular change in the structural features is analyzed. The [Gd2(H2O)4(chdc)3] compound has a similar composition but the topology of the three-dimensional network differs from that of the previous ones due to a decrease in the coordination number of metal centers. Heavier lanthanides, starting from Tb3+, and also yttrium(III) do not form compounds with the mentioned composition under similar reaction conditions.

elements.content: By a reaction of lanthanide nitrates with trans-1,4-cyclohexane dicarboxylic acid H2chdc in an aqueous medium new coordination polymers with the composition [Ln2(H2O)4(chdc)3] (Ln = Ce (1), Sm (2), Eu (3), Gd (4)) are obtained. Crystallization conditions are optimized with the use of a hexamine-based pH buffer. Compound 1 is additionally characterized by powder X-ray diffraction, elemental and thermogravimetric analyses, and IR spectroscopy. The structure of the obtained compounds is determined by single crystal X-ray diffraction. In a series of isostructural three-dimensional frameworks [Ln2(H2O)4(chdc)3] (Ln = La—Eu, except Pm) a regular change in the structural features is analyzed. The [Gd2(H2O)4(chdc)3] compound has a similar composition but the topology of the three-dimensional network differs from that of the previous ones due to a decrease in the coordination number of metal centers. Heavier lanthanides, starting from Tb3+, and also yttrium(III) do not form compounds with the mentioned composition under similar reaction conditions.
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

By a reaction of lanthanide nitrates with trans-1,4-cyclohexane dicarboxylic acid H2chdc in an aqueous medium new coordination polymers with the composition [Ln2(H2O)4(chdc)3] (Ln = Ce (1), Sm (2), Eu (3), Gd (4)) are obtained. Crystallization conditions are optimized with the use of a hexamine-based pH buffer. Compound 1 is additionally characterized by powder X-ray diffraction, elemental and thermogravimetric analyses, and IR spectroscopy. The structure of the obtained compounds is determined by single crystal X-ray diffraction. In a series of isostructural three-dimensional frameworks [Ln2(H2O)4(chdc)3] (Ln = La-Eu, except Pm) a regular change in the structural features is analyzed. The [Gd2(H2O)4(chdc)3] compound has a similar composition but the topology of the three-dimensional network differs from that of the previous ones due to a decrease in the coordination number of metal centers. Heavier lanthanides, starting from Tb3+, and also yttrium(III) do not form compounds with the mentioned composition under similar reaction conditions.

metadata.title: Gadolinium Break in a Series of Three-Dimensional trans-1,4-Cyclohexane Dicarboxylates of Rare Earth Elements
